SENT.plain: A 57 year-old patient presented with a Barrett's epithelium over the length of 18 cm
We found the typical functional changes of acid reflux and hypomotility in the distal esophagus
There was a history of chemotherapy for seminoma 30 years ago
Because of the repeated finding of severe dysplasia surgery was proposed
The patient died in the postoperative period with the signs and symptoms of pulmonary embolism
There was no invasive tumor found in the resected part of the esophagus
Main aspects of the etiology and histological characterism of Barrett's esophagus and the indication for surgery in cases with severe dysplasia are discussed
